hints.content:
Teo had $\$\purpleD{62}$ in his piggy bank. He paid $\$\blueE{17}$ for a stuffed animal.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/18f6d089c94819250a54d747d69c07209babae4c)

$\$\purpleD{62}-\$\blueE{17}=\$\maroonD{45}$

There were $\$\maroonD{45}$ left after buying the stuffed animal.

Teo gave his brother $\$\tealE{18}$ for his birthday.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8326b5b7e96ea10ea45957d22775dd8faf7ad0c0)

$\$\maroonD{45}-\$\tealE{18}=\$\goldE{27}$
Teo has $\$\goldE{27}$ left in his piggy bank,

question.content:
Teo had $\$62$ in his piggy bank. He took out $\$17$ to buy a stuffed animal. Then, he gave $\$18$ to his brother for his birthday. 

**How much money does Teo have left in his piggy bank?**  

$\$$ [[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]]
